As a bruiser main, this was an emotional roller coaster. I don't think grasp should've been reverted. It was the perfect way to tone down tanks a little without completely making the keystone unusable for them, while also giving bruisers a keystone that functions well for them and gives them their much needed sustained damage.

I can admit that while I was happy for the black cleaver buffs, they don't do anything to help the bruiser issue. Bruisers are having problems because they have no keystone that aids them in laning phase anywhere close to the extent that grasp does for tanks. The point when we get cleaver is when we typically start to outscale in the 1v1, provided the gold is relatively even. There's no need to exacerbate the powerspike gives bruisers 1v1/sidelane pressure in the midgame any more than new grasp already did. In addition to that, there are a lot of champions outside of the bruiser/fighter class that would benefit from BC buffs that just don't need that added power right now (for example, Miss Fortune), so yeah.

+1 for BC revert, -10000 for grasp revert.

I'm guessing that the Grasp revert doesn't mean that it won't be coming, just that Riot didn't feel confident in the current iteration to put it to live without further testing. It'll probably come back in some form or another in 8.1.

+1 to this. While we haven't locked on a specific direction, there's continued experimentation going on. We want to find some solution yet specifically in resolve - but rushing something as large as a keystone change as we headed into the break was a bit too concerning. No timelines yet for when Grasp or some other Keystone may be altered / added at some point, but we need to make sure we find an appealing and effective pattern first.

https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/LE4wox2k-meddler-what-fighters-need-from-runes-and-items-is-target-agnosticism-and-resilience

More or less, what fighters want out of a keystone is the ability to gain small rewards for fighting so they don't have to attain total victory over an opponent in order to gain an advantage. This is the most important thing that fighters need and that they lack from items or runes, as it is the only thing that could exist to separate them from other roles, which want to pick and choose fights based on the results of victory.

Without something like this to separate fighters from other roles, they would end up being boxed into the patterns of other classes (often like assassins or tanks)

1) Maokai is still a tank. Just because he doesn’t have damage reduction doesn’t mean he’s not a tank. If that’s the case, WW is more tank than Maokai, but that just isn’t true.

The difference is the purpose of the kit. Maokai’s kit is all about locking someone down (and extra jungle vision). His damage is because his numbers are tuned higher due to his Q being a key farming skill and has flat damage and low CD. He also still builds full tank, whereas Galio, a true AP bruiser, actually builds some AP along with tank items. Maokai does not. Damage reduction/defensive steroid doesn’t make someone a tank, it’s just a survivability ability. His kit still says “I’m a tank and you won’t be going anywhere”. Besides, he also has his heal for survivability.

2) Ornn is considered by many to be broken. More OP than broken, really, but still. I’m a mastery 6 Ornn, so I know he’s easy to outplay. He was an ideal tank before the change to %max HP, lower damae, could still farm, bugger focus on his utility and CC. The W damage was what sent him over the edge. That being said....no, he didn’t need an AP ratio. He didn’t need **any** damage buff to his W. His W was already his core skill and offered a lot. His kit was designed to drive players toward the tank build, not a damage build, because, well, need we flashback to full AP Maokai, Malphite, and Amumu?
